channel.title: üìú User Files on Analyst
channel.description: Recent content in üìú User Files on Analyst

item.title: üìò Manual
item.description: Data about a file is stored in several locations: system metadata (generated by the file system or doc management of the OS), substantive metadata (information that defines modifications to a document), embedded metadata (information embedded by the application that creates or edits the file), external metadata (separate doc, for example, a database).

item.title: üéû Media Files
item.description: Windows Recent documents Key üîë: NTUSER.DAT\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\RecentDocs Contains the list of all recent documents as a bunch and also the same data sorted by extension.

item.title: üç∫ IPA
item.description: I wish this article were about hazy ipa, but it’s far from that fascinating. I will dissect the IPA file format, Apple’s proprietary file format, for application packaging. This article will also provide useful tips on patching and repackaging it.

item.title: CAR
item.description: CAR is a proprietary file format used by Apple. It is a compiled asset catalogue created by Apple Xcode to store assets, such as icons, images, and textures, for iOS, tvOS, watchOS, and macOS applications.

item.title: plist
item.description: plist files are Apple config proprietary file format. It serves a similar purpose as the registry on Windows, but the files are scattered across the file system instead.

item.title: Office Documents
item.description: File Structure Macros A letter m at the end of extension means that doc has some macros inside.

item.title: PDFs
item.description: File Structure Malicious PDFs See more here. References Expand… [1]

item.title: PNG
item.description: Structure Malicious PNG It’s possible to craft polygon files that are legitimate PNG and PHP simultaneously.
